fields.name: areAdjacent
fields.description: Are a and b adjacent?

fields.name: call
fields.description: Compute some value.

fields.name: call
fields.description: What is the truth value of this predicate object?

fields.name: clear
fields.description: Clear the content of this object.

fields.name: doAction
fields.description: Perform the default action of this object.

fields.name: focus
fields.description: Give focus to the object. Input messages from the keyboard and mouse will go directly to this object after focus is called.

fields.name: getRandomObject
fields.description: Return a random object from a distribution

fields.name: instantiate
fields.description: Create an instance of a given type.

fields.name: nextInIteration
fields.description: Get the next object in the sequence. When the sequence is over, this should return null.

fields.name: pop
fields.description: Remove the object at the top of the stack and return it.

fields.name: push
fields.description: Push an object on top of the stack.

fields.name: read
fields.description: Read this content of this object.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: What was the reason for the last answer this predicate gave?

fields.name: resetIteration
fields.description: Reset the iteraction. The next call to nextInIteration should be the first in the sequence.

fields.name: write
fields.description: Write a value to the content of this object.

fields.name: Action
fields.description: Represents an procedure that can be called at specific points during game play. Actions can be hooked up to a target object, given a specific event name. When the target fires the event, the action is called.

fields.name: Any
fields.description: An empty interface. If you have an object of type any, then you don't know anything about it.

fields.name: Board
fields.description: A collection of cells. For any two cells, you can ask the question "Are these two cells adjacent?" Note that if A and B are adjacent the B and A are adjacent.

fields.name: Boolean
fields.description: A true or false value

fields.name: Clearable
fields.description: Can be cleared. Like erasing a chalk board.

fields.name: Distribution
fields.description: A space from which random objects can be sampled.

fields.name: Factory
fields.description: Used to generate instances of some type.

fields.name: Float
fields.description: A floating point decimal number.

fields.name: Focusable
fields.description: Represents an object which can be used for input. That is, it can be given focus to receive input from the keyboard.

fields.name: Function
fields.description: Represents a bound executable piece of code that returns a value.

fields.name: Integer
fields.description: A whole number either negative, zero, or positive.

fields.name: Iterable
fields.description: For collections of objects, allows each object in the collection to be visited one at a time.

fields.name: Nothing
fields.description: Represents a value that doesn't contain anything.

fields.name: Predicate
fields.description: A object which can be asked a "yes" or "no" question.

fields.name: Readable
fields.description: Can be converted to a string by reading it.

fields.name: Stack
fields.description: Like a stack of plates. The last plate you pushed onto the stack is the first plate to be popped off.

fields.name: String
fields.description: A sequence of characters.

fields.name: Writable
fields.description: Can be updated by writing a string.

fields.name: ActionPair
fields.description: Do action a, then do action b.

fields.name: Button
fields.description: A simple push button. Connect actions to its "click" event to make it useful.

fields.name: Cell
fields.description: A simple type used to contain another

fields.name: CellFactory
fields.description: A factory for creating cells.

fields.name: Clear
fields.description: Clear an object.

fields.name: EnterKeyPressed
fields.description: Do something when the enter key is pressed and when a given object has focus.

fields.name: GameStarted
fields.description: Connect an action to this object to have it execute at the start of the game.

fields.name: GiveFocus
fields.description: Give focus to a target object. After receiving focus, that object will accept input from the keyboard and mouse.

fields.name: HexagonalGrid
fields.description: A board in which each cell is shaped like a hexagon.

fields.name: InitializeCollection
fields.description: For each writable cell in a collection, provide a newly instantiated object.

fields.name: Label
fields.description: A simple way to place text on the screen. The value never changes throughout the game.

fields.name: List
fields.description: A vertical sequence of items that can be updated during the game.

fields.name: RandomEnglishLetters
fields.description: Distribution over the Latin alphabet. Generates letters in the frequency in which they occur in the English language.

fields.name: SayHello
fields.description: A simple object that just opens an alert box with a message. This object is useful during game design as a simple test that an action is getting triggered.

fields.name: SquareGrid
fields.description: A board arranged in rows and columns.

fields.name: SubmitStringWithCheck
fields.description: Action that reads a string from a source and if it is ok, sends it to a receiver. The source is cleared.

fields.name: TextField
fields.description: A text output field that can be updated during the game.

fields.name: TextInput
fields.description: For entering text.

fields.name: WordOnBoardPath
fields.description: Give a word, can a sequence of adjacent cells be found on a board where letters on those cells spell out the word?
